src.models package¶

Submodules¶

src.models.portfolio module¶

” This module defines a Portfolio class that represents a stock portfolio.

class src.models.portfolio.Portfolio[source]¶

Bases: object

A class to represent a stock portfolio.

Attributes:

cash (float): The amount of cash available in the portfolio tickers (dict): A dictionary mapping ticker symbols to Ticker objects file_path: Path to the JSON file for saving/loading portfolio data

buy_ticker(ticker: Ticker)[source]¶

Add or update a Ticker object in the portfolio, deducting cost from cash.

calculate_total_value() → float[source]¶

Calculate total portfolio value (cash + market value of tickers).

get_ticker(symbol: str) → Ticker[source]¶

Retrieve a Ticker by its symbol.

reset_portfolio()[source]¶

Reset portfolio to default state and clear the JSON file.

save_to_json()[source]¶

Save portfolio to a JSON file.

sell_ticker(ticker: Ticker)[source]¶

Sell a specific amount of a Ticker, adding proceeds to cash.

update_cash(amount: float)[source]¶

Add or subtract from cash.

src.models.ticker module¶

This module defines a Ticker class that represents a financial security.

class src.models.ticker.Ticker(symbol: str, amount: float)[source]¶

Bases: object

Represents a financial security held in a portfolio.

Attributes:

symbol (str): The stock ticker symbol (e.g., “MSFT”). amount (float): The value or quantity held of the security.

amount: float¶
current_value() → float[source]¶

Calculate the current total value of the holding.

get_current_price() → float[source]¶

Fetch the current price of the stock using yfinance.

symbol: str¶

Module contents¶

STOCK PORTFOLIO MANAGER
